description: A "Third Party" refers to a natural or legal person (of private or public law), authority, institution, or any other entity. By this definition, the "Third Party" is distinct from the data controller as well as the data subject and exists outside of the data processing entity. The transfer of personal data to Third Parties constitutes a data transmission. Consequently, such transmission falls within the scope of data processing under the applicable regulations.

A natural person is a living individual who is to be distinguished from a legal entity. Within the context of the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR), a natural person is always understood in their identifiable or identified form. This individual is also referred to as the data subject. The personal data relating to the identifiable or identified natural person fall under the scope of the GDPR and may only be used in accordance with its provisions.
